main event: Two unidentified objects, resembling balloons, were observed in Alberton, Montana on 30 May 1956. The objects appeared to be descending and changed color from white to red at disappearance.
interesting points: The objects were observed for 47 minutes at an altitude of 40,000 feet.
It was suggested that the sighting could possibly be attributed to two balloons that were known to have lost pressure and descended in the area.
The conclusion of the observation was categorized as 'E Was Balloon' and 'B Probably Balloon' indicating a likely prosaic explanation.
The sighting was a Ground-Visual type of observation made by the Air Force.
The source of the observation was Civil 313 AB.
